# Distributions in R

- Normal
- Poisson
- Binomial vs Poisson

## Learning Objectives

- Understand R's distribution function convention
d*, p*, q*, r*
- Compute PDF/PMF, CDF and quantiles for Normal and Poisson distributions
- Simulate values and run basic reasonableness checks (mean/sd for Normal, mean/variance for Poisson)
- Distinguish Binomial vs Poisson

R uses a consistent naming convention across distributions:

```{r}
# ddist
dnorm()

```

`dnorm` returns density (continuous) or probability mass (discrete)
